info.name: Gazer
info.description: Gazer creature from Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse.

element.name: Gazer
element.source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

setters.set: 12 + (3+Con modifier multiplied with every warlock level after 4th) (the aberration has Hit Dice [d4s] equal to your warlock level) (2d4)

element.name: Mimicry
element.source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.p: The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check against a DC of 8 + the Gazer's proficiency bonus.

element.name: Hover
element.source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.p: While this creature is flying, if it is knocked prone or is otherwise deprived of the ability to move it stays afloat in its space.

element.name: Bite
element.source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.p: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

element.name: Eye Rays
element.source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.p: The gazer shoots one of the following magical eye rays at random (roll 1d4, reroll duplicates and 4's), choosing one target it can see within 60 feet of it:
1: Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to the Player's Spell Save DC or be frightened until the start of the gazer's next turn.
2: Frost Ray. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to the Player's Spell Save DC or take 4 (2d6) cold damage.

3: Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to the Player's Spell Save DC or be moved up to 15 feet directly away from the gazer. If the target is a Tiny object that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to 15 feet in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.
